intro: Ampelocissus sarcantha, commonly known as the white-veined leafy vine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves with distinct white veins. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by red, fleshy berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value comes from its attractive foliage and unique fruit structure.
